what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal habistats …

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version habistats like :

title: Utilities for caching — cache_dir
text: expensive operations cached avoid recomputing . Intermediate results stored cache directory. Users can set via habistats.cache_dir option. default set tools::R_user_dir().

title: Utilities for caching — cache_dir
Utilities for caching — cache_dir
text: cache_dir() returns path cache directory.

title: Utilities for caching — cache_dir
text: General recommendation set persistent directory easy access, ~/.cache/habistats, temporary directory like tempdir(). working shared machine users, setting cache directory allow share cache.

title: Utilities for caching — cache_dir
code: old = options(habistats.cache_dir = "~/.cache/habistats-example")  habistats::cache_dir() #> ~/.cache/habistats-example  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Calculate the size   fs::dir_info(habistats::cache_dir(), recurse = TRUE)$size |> sum() } # }  options(old) # reset for this example, not needed in real use

what: Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
title: Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
text: geometry column IUCN Spatial Data evaluated several ways. Currently, perimeter, area, features calculated.

title: Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
text: sci_name character vector species names. iucn_source Path directory containing IUCN shape files. iucn_source_path() used NULL given (default).

title: Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
text: evaluate_iucn_range() returns data.frame.

title: Use geometry column of IUCN Spatial Data — evaluate_iucn_range
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ options(habistats.iucn_source = "path/to/your/data") habistats::iucn_source_path() } # } old = options(habistats.cache_dir = "~/.cache/habistats-example")  sn = c("Strato arctica", "Diva satanica") habistats::evaluate_iucn_range(sn) #> # A tibble: 2 × 8 #>   sci_name       perimeter       area abundance richness idx_shannon idx_simpson #>   <chr>              <dbl>      <dbl>     <int>    <int>       <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Strato arctica  3201738.    3.39e11      9182        4       0.503       0.700 #> 2 Diva satanica   6784114.    8.04e11     18060        6       0.940       0.441 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: idx_brillouin <dbl>  options(old) # reset for this example, not needed in real use

what: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
text: iucn_species_gpkg() splits IUCN shape files separate gpkg files species, returns paths. allows parallel processing downstream analysis, avoids need read large shape files . Use iucn_spatial_species() iucn_spatial_features() quick skimming whole dataset, determine species analyze.

title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
code: iucn_spatial_species(iucn_source = NULL)  iucn_species_gpkg(iucn_source = NULL, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
text: iucn_source Path directory containing IUCN shape files. iucn_source_path() used NULL given (default). overwrite Whether overwrite existing cache files.

title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
text: iucn_spatial_species() returns data.frame extracted iucn_spatial_features(). iucn_species_gpkg() returns data.frame two columns, "sci_name" "source", used evaluate_iucn_range().

title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ options(habistats.iucn_source = "path/to/your/data") habistats::iucn_source_path() } # } old = options(habistats.cache_dir = "~/.cache/habistats-example")  habistats::cache_dir() #> ~/.cache/habistats-example  habistats::iucn_spatial_species() #> # A tibble: 4 × 11 #>   kingdom  phylum  class order_ family genus sci_name category marine terrestria #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>    <lgl>  <lgl>      #> 1 ANIMALIA CHORDA… MAMM… CARNI… CANID… Stra… Strato … LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 2 ANIMALIA CHORDA… AVES  PASSE… CORVI… Diva  Diva sa… LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 3 PLANTAE  TRACHE… MAGN… CUCUR… CUCUR… Kai   Kai kis… LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 4 ANIMALIA CHORDA… MAMM… CINGU… CHLAM… Elp   Elp tar… EW       FALSE  TRUE       #> # ℹ 1 more variable: freshwater <lgl>  habistats::iucn_species_gpkg() #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   sci_name       source                                                          #>   <chr>          <fs::path>                                                      #> 1 Strato arctica …A/MAMMALIA/CARNIVORA/CANIDAE/Strato/Strato_arctica/source.gpkg #> 2 Diva satanica  …ATA/AVES/PASSERIFORMES/CORVIDAE/Diva/Diva_satanica/source.gpkg #> 3 Kai kiske      …OLIOPSIDA/CUCURBITALES/CUCURBITACEAE/Kai/Kai_kiske/source.gpkg #> 4 Elp tarkus     …A/MAMMALIA/CINGULATA/CHLAMYPHORIDAE/Elp/Elp_tarkus/source.gpkg  options(old) # reset for this example, not needed in real use

what: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
title: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
text: IUCN Spatial Data large collection shape files, package provides efficient ways read process . may take run first time, subsequent runs quick results cached. iucn_spatial_features() reads IUCN shape files drops geometry column. useful quick skimming whole dataset. Set habistats.iucn_source option specify path directory containing IUCN shape files, use iucn_source_path() check .

title: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
text: iucn_source Path directory containing IUCN shape files. iucn_source_path() used NULL given (default). overwrite Whether overwrite existing cache files.

title: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
text: iucn_spatial_features() returns data.frame feature columns. iucn_source_path() returns path read option.

title: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ options(habistats.iucn_source = "path/to/your/data") habistats::iucn_source_path() } # } old = options(habistats.cache_dir = "~/.cache/habistats-example")  habistats::cache_dir() #> ~/.cache/habistats-example  habistats::iucn_spatial_features() #> # A tibble: 5 × 28 #>      id_no sci_name       presence origin seasonal compiler yrcompiled citation  #>      <int> <chr>             <int>  <int>    <int> <chr>         <int> <chr>     #> 1 19990904 Strato arctica        1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 2 20010425 Diva satanica         1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 3 20010425 Diva satanica         1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 4 19851118 Kai kiske             1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 5 19710604 Elp tarkus            5      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> # ℹ 20 more variables: subspecies <chr>, subpop <chr>, source <lgl>, #> #   island <chr>, tax_comm <chr>, dist_comm <chr>, generalisd <int>, #> #   legend <chr>, kingdom <chr>, phylum <chr>, class <chr>, order_ <chr>, #> #   family <chr>, genus <chr>, category <chr>, marine <lgl>, terrestria <lgl>, #> #   freshwater <lgl>, SHAPE_Leng <dbl>, SHAPE_Area <dbl>  options(old) # reset for this example, not needed in real use

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: raster_kgc() gives easy access Köppen-Geiger climate classification raster data. can cropped given polygon. scale_color_kgc() scale_fill_kgc() ggplot2 color scales used KGC raster.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: stars object 2 dimensions 1 attribute.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: https://koeppen-geiger.vu-wien.ac.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: mask sf sfc object. ... passed ggplot2::scale_fill_manual().

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: raster_kgc() returns stars object. scale_color_kgc() scale_fill_kgc() return ggplot2 scale.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
code: library(ggplot2) geo_jp = rnaturalearth::ne_countries(country = "Japan") kgc_jp = habistats::raster_kgc(geo_jp) |> print() #> stars object with 2 dimensions and 1 attribute #> attribute(s): #>  KG_1986-2010.grd  #>  Cfa    : 3637     #>  Dfb    : 1689     #>  Cfb    :  307     #>  Ocean  :  151     #>  Dfc    :  150     #>  (Other):   31     #>  NA's   :28160     #> dimension(s): #>   from   to offset    delta refsys x/y #> x 3713 3907   -180  0.08333 WGS 84 [x] #> y  534  708     90 -0.08333 WGS 84 [y] ggplot(geo_jp) +   stars::geom_stars(data = kgc_jp) +   geom_sf(linewidth = 1, color = "#00000088", fill = NA) +   scale_fill_kgc(na.value = "transparent") +   theme_minimal()

what: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
title: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
text: lmap*() similar lapply(), map subset .x[] instead element .x[[]]. allows .f access attributes encapsulating list. useful operation sfc column sf data.frame. purrr::lmap() similar things, forces output list. mclmap*() parallelized versions lmap*().

title: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
code: lmap_lst(.x, .f, mode = c("list", "integer", "double", "character", "logical"))  lmap_lgl(.x, .f)  lmap_int(.x, .f)  lmap_dbl(.x, .f)  lmap_chr(.x, .f)  lmap_vec(.x, .f)  mclmap_lst(.x, .f, ...)  mclmap_lgl(.x, .f, ...)  mclmap_int(.x, .f, ...)  mclmap_dbl(.x, .f, ...)  mclmap_chr(.x, .f, ...)  mclmap_vec(.x, .f, ...)

title: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
text: .x list. .f function apply subset .x. mode Output type. ... Additional arguments passed parallel::mclapply().

what: Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
title: Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
text: quantify_raster() calculates various diversity indices raster layers. table_raster() counts occurrences.

title: Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
text: ras stars object. ... Additional arguments passed tabulate() table(). use.names logical. TRUE, levels input preserved names output.

title: Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
text: quantify_raster() returns data.frame. table_raster() returns list integer vectors.

title: Qantify spatial data in raster format — quantify_raster
code: ras = raster_kgc() quantify_raster(ras) #>   abundance richness idx_shannon idx_simpson idx_brillouin #> 1   9331200       32    1.526108   0.4452376      1.526088  table_raster(ras, use.names = TRUE) #> $`KG_1986-2010.grd` #>      Af      Am      As      Aw     BSh     BSk     BWh     BWk     Cfa     Cfb  #>   85453   60843    8988  211067  122450  122017  271961   77759  103870   79771  #>     Cfc     Csa     Csb     Csc     Cwa     Cwb     Cwc     Dfa     Dfb     Dfc  #>    7642   34680   22706     527   52994   21312     582   22800  166976  362990  #>     Dfd     Dsa     Dsb     Dsc     Dsd     Dwa     Dwb     Dwc     Dwd      EF  #>   31636    1816    7661   31879    6966    9324   22304   47793    5709  963667  #>      ET   Ocean  #>  247492 6117565  #>

what: Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
title: Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
text: quantify_vector() calculates basic spatial features vector geometry perimeter area. quantify_vector_kgc(), addition, quantifies Köppen-Geiger climate classification range cropped raster_kgc().

title: Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
text: geom sfc sf object. path sf-readable file accepted.

title: Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
text: data.frame.

title: Quantify spatial data in vector format — quantify_vector_kgc
code: geom = rnaturalearth::ne_countries(country = "Japan") |> sf::st_geometry() quantify_vector_kgc(geom) #>   perimeter         area abundance richness idx_shannon idx_simpson #> 1   6474035 404420164917      5965        6    1.024642   0.4558865 #>   idx_brillouin #> 1      1.021681

title: Rowwise operations — rowwise_map
text: rowwise_*() functions apply function row data.frame. input function .f single-row subset class. useful handling subclasses data.frame, sf. base::apply(.x, 1L, .f) converts input matrix. rowwise_mcmap*() parallelized versions rowwise_map*().

title: Rowwise operations — rowwise_map
code: rowwise_map(   .x,   .f,   mode = c("list", "integer", "double", "character", "logical") )  rowwise_map_lgl(.x, .f)  rowwise_map_int(.x, .f)  rowwise_map_dbl(.x, .f)  rowwise_map_chr(.x, .f)  rowwise_map_vec(.x, .f)  rowwise_mcmap(.x, .f, ...)  rowwise_mcmap_lgl(.x, .f, ...)  rowwise_mcmap_int(.x, .f, ...)  rowwise_mcmap_dbl(.x, .f, ...)  rowwise_mcmap_chr(.x, .f, ...)  rowwise_mcmap_vec(.x, .f, ...)

title: Rowwise operations — rowwise_map
text: .x data frame-like object. .f function apply row. mode Output type. ... Additional arguments passed parallel::mclapply().
